channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Climate change mans Southern Africa got a year’s worth of rain in just 10 days, killing over 100 people
item.description: Around 1.3 million people across southern Africa were affected by this month's floods, The World Health Organization said.

item.title: German chancellor on Trump’s claim that it didn’t fight in Afghanistan: we lost 59 soldiers
item.description: Friedrich Merz said that not only did 59 German troops die in Afghanistan over nearly 20 years, but well over 100 were wounded as well.

item.title: A spectre is haunting Europe — the spectre of Trump. Cue the Asian trade deals
item.description: From a purely economic perspective, Trump's import tariffs have sent countries seeking new markets to reduce their dependency on the American consumer...

item.title: How stroopwafels and saffron tiramisu fit into Starbucks’ plan to get to 40,000 stores around the world
item.description: The CEO of its international business doesn't see anti-U.S. feeling hurting business.

item.title: What Minnesota resistance really looks like: a health care worker who patrols in her beat-up Subaru, watching for signs of federal agents
item.description: "Sunshine" says she can spot idling SUVs, out-of-state plates and the difference between an undercover cop car from an unmarked immigration vehicle.

item.title: Microsoft shares’ post-earnings-report slump could be worst since 2013
Investors should be keeping a close eye on the ‘fear gauge’ today — live updates
Investors are applauding the end of Southwest’s open-seating era
Fed chief sees a stabilizing labor market. Here’s what jobless-claims data show.
Oil prices surge nearly 5% as market wagers U.S. strike on Iran is imminent
